title: Who’s (not) having babies
summary: Fewer babies have been born per woman in most parts of the world in the last seven decades. From as many as five births per woman in the early 1950s and four births per woman in the mid-1970s, the global average fertility rate had plunged to 2.3 births in 2021 and is projected to slip further to 2.1 births per woman by 2050 – the rate at which a population exactly replaces itself.
